Key Match Events: Mahmudullah (41) scored the highest runs for Bangladesh
Mehidy Hasan Miraz and Parvez Hossain Emon scored 16 runs each
India's Varun Chakravarthy and Nitish Reddy picked two wickets each
Arshdeep Singh, Washington Sundar, Abhishek Sharma, Mayank Yadav, and Riyan Parag each picked one wicket
Nitish Reddy became 'Player of the Match' for scoring 74 runs and 2 wickets
Pre-Game Insights: India decided to hand debut caps to Mayank Yadav and Nitish Kumar Reddy in Gwalior
Both debutants are expected to get another chance on Wednesday
Mayank Yadav made an impressive start to his international career with a maiden over and also went on to claim a wicket
Reddy played a knock of 16 runs* and bowled a couple of overs
Varun Chakaravarthy claimed three wickets in his comeback after almost three years
Post-Match Reflections: Suryakumar Yadav said, 'I wanted that situation, wanted my batters (5,6,7) in that situation. Happy for both (Rinku and Nitish) of them. They batted exactly the way I wanted.'
Nazmul Hossain Shanto said, 'I think we made the same mistakes (like the first game), not a good thing as a team. We need to improve.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: India defeated Bangladesh in the second T20I match by 86 runs at Delhi's Arun Jaitley Stadium on 9 October, clinching the series by 2-0
The third T20I match will be played in Hyderabad on October 12
Others: Bangladesh could score just 135/9 runs chasing a target of 221 runs
For Bangladesh, Rishad Hossain took three wickets, and Taskin Ahmed, Mustafizur Rahman, and Tanzim Hasan Sakib each took two wickets
India's Rinku Singh and Nitish Reddy scored their half-centuries with their smashing innings
